sub_topic: The butterfly effect and its implications in chaotic systems
message_1: A butterfly flaps its wings in Brazil, causing a tiny disturbance in the atmosphere. According to chaos theory, this disturbance could eventually lead to a tornado forming in Texas in two weeks. If the probability of the butterfly flapping its wings at a particular moment is 0.001 and the probability of a tornado forming in Texas in two weeks is 0.05, what is the probability of the butterfly flap being the cause of the tornado forming in Texas in two weeks?
